citation.article-title: Bogoriella caseilytica gen. nov., sp. nov., a new alkaliphilic actinomycete from a soda lake in Africa

p.s: Bogoriella (Bo.go.ri.el'la. M. L. dim. fem. n. Bogoriella, named after Lake Bogoria in Kenya, the place from which isolate HKI 0088T originated)
Cells are irregular and rod shaped or coccoid and occur singly, in pairs, or in small irregular clusters.
The cells are gram positive, not acid fast, and nonmotile.
Very poor growth can occur under anaerobic conditions.
The peptidoglycan type is type A4a with lysine as the characteristic diamino acid.
The phospholipids are phosphatidylglycerol, diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylinositol, and an unknown phospholipid.
Mycolic acids are absent, and the cellular fatty acids are of the isoand anteiso-branched type; 12-methyltetradecanoic acid is the major fatty acid.
The G+C content of the DNA is 70 mol%.
The type species is Bogoriella caseilytica.
